newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Illovo confident of 20 pct profit increase.
newsitem.headline: Illovo confident of 20 pct profit increase.

text.p: South Africa's biggest sugar producer, Illovo Sugar Ltd, said on Friday it was confident of achieving a forecast 20 percent increase in profits for the half year to March 31, 1997.
Chairman Glyn Taylor said at the company's annual general meeting that the production estimate of just under a million tonnes for the 1996/1997 sugar season was a company record.
"It exceeds last year's output by 23 percent or 186,000 tonnes of sugar and our share of the industry remains at 44.2 percent" he said.
Taylor added that all export sugar had been priced and domestic sales were ahead of budget. Plant efficiencies and sales of furfural products and alcohol were also ahead of budget.
"Taking account of these factors we are confident that we will achieve the forecasted 20 percent improvement in profits for the half year to March 31, 1997," he said.
Taylor said prospects for the full financial year looked promising with good rains in supply areas pointing to another bumper crop.
"Moreover, we can expect a better all-round factory performance next season and this augurs well for the full financial year."
